data.title: J. Jean Meek
data.meta_description: J. Jean Meek, 95, formerly of Deer Creek, passed away at 2:55 a.m. Monday Oct. 11, 2021, at Miller’s Merry Manor in Logansport. data.text:
J. Jean Meek, 95, formerly of Deer Creek, passed away at 2:55 a.m. Monday Oct. 11, 2021, at Miller’s Merry Manor in Logansport.

She was born Sept. 18, 1926, in Deer Creek, to Abraham and Lottie Fry Williams.

Jean was the 14th of 14 Williams children and enjoyed letting everyone know she was the “baby” of the family.

She was a 1944 graduate of Deer Creek High School. On Sept. 18, 1946, she married Lowell F. Meek; he preceded her in death Nov. 24, 1982.

Jean was secretary and custodian for the Deer Creek Presbyterian Church until retiring in 2003. She was a member there for over 50 years and an active member of the Presbyterian Women’s group and played an important role in the church prayer chain.

She was a member of ACDC in Deer Creek. She enjoyed reading, especially her Bible and sitting on her porch visiting with friends. She always had a smile and a wave for everyone.

She is survived by her daughter, Bonnie Myers (Paul) of Deer Creek and Mark C. Meek (Val) of Sarasota, Fla.; her grandchildren, Rich Taylor of Rochester, Shelli Taylor of Lafayette, Shawn Meek (Emily) of Deer Creek, Jeremy Meek (Stephanie) of Kokomo, Erin and Ryan Meek of Palm Bay, Fla.; great-grandchildren, Madison Taylor of Norfolk, Va., Keeton and Kaleb Meek of Deer Creek, Kaytlin Loges (Zack) of Kokomo, Kayden and Kayla Meek of Kokomo; stepgrand and stepgreat-grandchildren, Cathy Witucki (Chris) of Canyon Country, Calif., Ben and Caitlin Roach of Washington, Chiara Casiglia (Joe) of Detroit, Mich., Paula and Quentin Dodd, Charlie and Elizabeth Dodd, all of Crawfordsville.

She was also preceded in death by her parents; her son, Gregory L. Meek; seven brothers and six sisters.

Funeral service will be at 1 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 16, at the Deer Creek Presbyterian Church with Pastor Harry Roselle officiating. Friends may call from 11 a.m. until time of service at the church. Burial will follow at Maple Lawn Cemetery, Flora.

Memorial contributions may be made to the Deer Creek Presbyterian Church.

Cree Funeral Home, Camden is assisting the family with arrangements.
